case_body_condition: Not recognizable - Partial skeletal parts only
case_circumstances: On July 7, 1994, hikers found human remains to include a skull and mandible. The items were turned over to Montrose County Sheriffâ€™s Office Investigator Mike Wiggins on July 7, 1994. The area where the skull was located is a remote, high mountain forest. An extensive search of the area where the items were located resulted in the finding of several bones and bone fragments that had been extensively damaged by bears, coyotes and other scavenging animals. A belt was also found at the scene but no clothing, jewelry or other items were found to aid in the identification of the skeletal remains.
case_head_hair: The hair found on scene appears to be redish brown in color and 8 to 10 inches in lenght.
